title: Stately piles, whisky distilleries and stargazing in the Cairngorms: what it's like to spend four nights on the Royal Scotsman
text:
Scotland has a dark side. Aye - darker than you might care to imagine. I am not talking about the sort of grisly unpleasantness that would have Inspector Rebus working overtime or give Lady Macbeth the heebie-jeebies.

I am talking about particular places that are actually, objectively, measurably very, very dark at night, in a way that makes tying your shoelaces challenging and astronomers giddy with excitement.

Astronomers tend to be hardy, patient, tolerant types, content to stand around in fields in the middle of nowhere for hours at a time, layered up, Thermos in one hand, binoculars in the other.

The standing around in fields is difficult to avoid if contemplating the heavens is your bag....
